title: Stage S19
description: Level 1 grammar practice focusing on stage-specific patterns and expressions.
examples: Although it was raining, we went hiking.
Even though he's tired, he keeps working.
learning_points: Level 1 target grammar and expressions with practical usage examples

sentences.kr: 비가 왔지만 우리는 하이킹을 갔어요. (양보)
sentences.en: Although it was raining, we went hiking.

sentences.kr: 피곤하지만 그는 계속 일해요. (강한 양보)
sentences.en: Even though he's tired, he keeps working.

sentences.kr: 그는 친절해요. 하지만 직장에서는 엄격할 수 있어요.
sentences.en: He is kind. However, he can be strict at work.

sentences.kr: 저는 커피를 좋아해요. 반면에 아내는 차를 더 좋아해요.
sentences.en: I like coffee. On the other hand, my wife prefers tea.

sentences.kr: 저는 독서를 즐기는 반면, 형/동생은 스포츠를 좋아해요.
sentences.en: While I enjoy reading, my brother loves sports.

sentences.kr: 나쁜 날씨에도 불구하고 행사는 성공적이었어요.
sentences.en: Despite the bad weather, the event was successful.

sentences.kr: 어리지만 그녀는 매우 성숙해요.
sentences.en: In spite of being young, she is very mature.

sentences.kr: 영화가 비쌌어요. 그럼에도 불구하고 볼 만했어요.
sentences.en: The movie was expensive. Nevertheless, it was worth watching.

sentences.kr: 어렵지만 포기하지 않을 거예요.
sentences.en: Though it's difficult, I won't give up.

sentences.kr: 그녀는 열심히 공부해요. 반대로 여동생은 게을러요.
sentences.en: She studies hard. In contrast, her sister is lazy.
